oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A SINGLE-POINT CHIRAL INVERSION THAT SELFORGANIZES A RANDOMCOIL PEPTIDE - APOLAR SOLVENT CONFORMATION OF BOC-(L-BACKSLASH-D)-GLU-ALA-LEU-LYSNHME
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: BOBDE, V
BERI, S
RAWALE, S
SATYANARAYANA, CVV
DURANI, S
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: alpha-helix formation
stabilization
templates
proteins
alanine
water
model
glu
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The tetrapeptide Boc-L-Glu-Ala-Leu-LysNHMe (1) reveals a random coil conformation, based on its Glu(gamma) and Lys(epsilon) methylene proton aniosotropic shift, GluNH chemical shift, NOEs in chloroform-DMSO (6:1), and its amide proton temperature coefficients in DMSO, while on similar considerations, the diastereomer Boc-D-Glu-Ala-Leu-LysNHMe (2) is characterized as a highly ordered 3/10 type distorted protohelix with a remarkably stable intramolecular salt bridge under these solvent conditions.
